children.subject:
We will not grant you more than 13.5 units for Phase 1 so if you opt to use all your units on other classes and then CS 61C opens you will need to drop something else to enroll into CS 61C.

Priority for EECS majors extends through most of Phase 2. If you choose to enroll in CS 61C during phase 2 and there are open seats, you will be enrolled over other students who are on the wait list. Please see https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#lower for exact information regarding enrollment priorities.
To be perfectly clear, if we planned on using phase 1 units on 61c, can we use those units for other classes while still getting priority on 61c if we're eecs?
Hi, I'm trying to enroll in CS 195 (Ethics) but am unable to do so during my Phase 1 enrollment. Please help. Thank You.
No because it shows that department consent is required
It doesn't show it now, but it does show its full, despite having no enrollment.
CS 189 remains CLOSED.

what does 	
Requested General Assignment mean?
Has the CS189 issue been resolved? It shows up as open for me on CalCentral's shopping cart (but it still says "Requested General Assignment" for the room)
https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper
What is the rule for non-major enrollment in CS186?

Try reading the actual post above for info regarding CS 189. We use Dept Consent to indicate the class is temporarily closed. When I am able to open it for enrollment I will update post AND create a new post in EECS 101 as well.
I am unable to enroll in CS189, when will the course open?
They can with instructor approval. The enrollment system prevents undergrads from being able to directly enroll or wait list for grad level classes.
Can undergrads enroll in the graduate version of stat C100 (stat C200)?
@8873 From the draft schedule, Sergey Levine will teach CS 188 in Spring 2020
Do you know who is going to be teaching CS188 next Spring 2020?

Nope - you should still be able to wait list yourself but the wait list maxed out while I was in meetings today. I just increased the wait list size so you should now be able to add yourself to the wait list.
thank you!
will the waitlist be further expanded? cannot add it currently
I just expanded the wait list for CS 188 earlier this afternoon.

for classes with the 70% rule, when you say you hold back 30% of the seats. Does this mean you can still waitlist yourself if 70% seats are filled up, or do you actually close the class but later on expand. Asking in light of CSW186 being closed, can we expect it to be expanded
There are some differences in how STAT manages the class versus how CompSci manages the class so it's best if you reach out to them with this question. I cannot answer it for them.
Since Data 100 is being offered through the stat department would CalCentral allow me to have a conflict with lecture?
Until the instructor is confident about being able to hire enough teaching support staff. It varies from class to class.
How long do classes usually stay on the 70% rule?
yeah it seems like there are less offered and less seats in the ones that are offered, I am having a lot of trouble finding a schedule that works
would 152 be potentially offered in the Fall?
I have no response to that - it's faculty decision which classes to offer.
Why are there so few upper division CS courses in the Fall? Will the list be expanded?

If you don't meet the reserve requirements the system will place you on the wait list and bypass you until 8/19 when the adjustment period begins. The system is set to allow time conflicts but sometimes it kicks up a fuss. If there are seats available on 8/19 and you don't see any change in your wait list position by 8/20, email cs-enrollments@cs.berkeley.edu and be sure to include your SID number in that correspondence.
Alright thank you. Just to confirm, I won't be able to enroll in the class even if there are open unreserved seats if I have a tome conflict?
That depends on how the class is set up. For F19, CS 170 is set to allow time conflicts which means that you SHOULD be able to enroll into open seats beginning 8/19 or later.
Oh, I was just confused because the 14th May announcement said time conflicts aren't allowed. Is there any way of knowing for sure?
Is there an update to this, by any chance?
CS 70 does not allow time conflicts. CS 170 will.

If I tried enrolling in 170 as a non CS/EECS major with a time conflict during phase 1 or phase 2, would CalCentral not let me enroll at all, or waitlist me and then pass me over during waitlist processing?

I initially Phase 1'd 170 and was waitlisted (because I don't meet reservation requirements) and didn't think my time conflict was a problem. Having read the update, I no longer know what to do.
Same question here. If I enrol on the waitlist now, will they expand the class to accommodate everyone as it is webcast?
Professor has indicated that this class will NOT expand further. If you are just now enrolling, your best bet is to wait for SP20 and find another class instead. You won't get in.
Is Cs188 still expanding for the fall semester?
The wait list is so long that you're unlikely to get in if you aren't fairly high up on the wait list already.
is cs162 already closed?

history.content:
F19 Enrollment: Upper Division CompSci Classes

[Updated 8/20/19]

 

This is the master list of announcements for F19 upper div CS classes.  General enrollment information is at the end of this post.

 

New for F19: The enrollment system will now enforce credit restrictions at enrollment. Credit restrictions occur when the content of one course overlaps with another offered at UCB to such a degree that students should not receive credit for taking both courses.


Currently there is no warning for students if a class they are enroll into has a credit restriction with a class they have already completed. Beginning in F19 enrollment, a warning message will appear to warn of the restriction.

 

  • CS C100/C200A – Enrollment for this class is being managed by STAT department for F19. Students should enroll into STAT C100.

  • CS 160/260A – Enroll into lecture and 999 section. Read the end of this post to learn more about the 999 sections.
    Wait list is closed and enrollment will not exceed 120 students combined in the two classes. See @9445 to read what Prof Paulos says about this class.

  • CS 161 – Enroll into lecture and 999 section.

  • CS 162 - Enroll into lecture and 999 section. This is an EARLY DROP DEADLINE class.

  • CS 164 – Enroll into lecture and 999 section. 

  • CS 169 - (07/23/19 NEW!) Enrollment for class will open soon. Still not sure about how to enroll - wait for separate listing regarding class. NO time conflicts will be allowed. This is a team based class and attendance is expected in lecture and associated section. This is an EARLY DROP DEADLINE class.

  • CS 170 – (8/20/19 UPDATE)  Class has just expanded to 940 students. Class will be webcast. Enroll into lecture and 999 section. 

  • CS 174 –Enroll into lecture and section.

  • CS 176 – This class has been canceled!

  • CS W186 – Lecture is web-based only for this class but in-person discussion sections and office-hours will be held. Enroll into lecture and 999 section.

  • CS 188 – This class will NOT expand past room capacity. Enroll into the lecture and the 999 section.

  • CS 189/289A – Enroll into the lecture and the 999 section. This class will NOT allow time conflicts nor will it be webcast/expand beyond room capacity.

  • CS 194-034 – Enroll into the lecture only.

  • CS 195 – Enroll into the lecture only.

 

 

The remainder of this post contains general enrollment information.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS upper div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper

  2. Time Conflicts – Unless noted, the enrollment system WILL ALLOW time conflicts between CompSci classes and other classes. However, even though CalCentral will allow enrollment into both classes, it is still the student’s responsibility to plan their schedule carefully. Departments and faculty are NOT required or expected to accommodate students’ schedule conflicts, and the Instructor of Record may decline to enroll or Instructor Drop a student from a class if they cannot be present for all schedule activities, including midterms and finals.

    Best practice is to check attendance policies for each class and to speak to the instructors before enrolling in time conflicted classes.

  3. Waitlist Processing:
  • We will NOT purge the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

  • During the Adjustment Period, wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed. During Phases 1 and 2, students who meet reserve requirements for a class will be enrolled from the wait list if there are open seats, even before students with a better wait list position who do not meet reserve requirements.

  • If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

  • Waitlisted students who have time conflicts will no longer be held on the waitlist and will now be processed in sequential order like any other student. (As in the past, not meeting a reserve cap or exceeding the unit limit will still prevent students from being enrolled from the wait list.)

    Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

  1. 70% Rule - When hiring is uncertain for discussion section GSI/TA staff, we hold back 30% of seats. Once we know what the hiring will be for a class, we release these seats back to regular enrollment process. You can expect enrollment for these classes to expand.

  2. 999 sections will be used for many but not all upper div classes. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central. 

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu


Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

  • During first lecture
  • Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form or SignMeUp!)
  • Via course home page

history.content:
F19 Enrollment: Upper Division CompSci Classes

[Updated 5/22/19]

 

This is the master list of announcements for F19 upper div CS classes.  General enrollment information is at the end of this post.

 

New for F19: The enrollment system will now enforce credit restrictions at enrollment. Credit restrictions occur when the content of one course overlaps with another offered at UCB to such a degree that students should not receive credit for taking both courses.


Currently there is no warning for students if a class they are enroll into has a credit restriction with a class they have already completed. Beginning in F19 enrollment, a warning message will appear to warn of the restriction.

 

  • CS C100/C200A – Enrollment for this class is being managed by STAT department for F19. Students should enroll into STAT C100.

  • CS 160/260A – 70% rule is in effect. Enroll into lecture and 999 section. Read the end of this post to learn more about the 70% rule and about 999 sections.
    Wait list is closed and enrollment will not exceed 120 students combined in the two classes. See @9445 to read what Prof Paulos says about this class.

  • CS 161 – (5/22/19) Enrollment has been expanded to full capacity. Enroll into lecture and 999 section.

  • CS 162 - This class is now temporarily CLOSED as the lecture may change day/time. We use Department Consent to indicate the class is closed. See post @9191 for more information. Enroll into lecture and 999 section. This is an EARLY DROP DEADLINE class.

  • CS 164 – Enroll into lecture and 999 section. 

  • CS 170 – (5/14/19 update) Class just expanded to 875. Enroll into lecture and 999 section. NO time conflicts will be allowed for this class!

  • CS 174 –Enroll into lecture and section.

  • CS 176 – This class has been canceled!

  • CS W186 – Class has been expanded to 535 seats. Lecture is web-based only for this class but in-person discussion sections and office-hours will be held. Enroll into lecture and 999 section.

  • CS 188 – (5/14/19 update) Class just expanded to 744. Enroll into the lecture and the 999 section.

  • CS 189/289A – Enroll into the lecture and the 999 section. This class will not allow time conflicts nor will it be webcast/expand beyond room capacity.

  • CS 194-034 – Enroll into the lecture only.

  • CS 195 – Enroll into the lecture only.

 

 

The remainder of this post contains general enrollment information.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS upper div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper

  2. Time Conflicts – Unless noted, the enrollment system WILL ALLOW time conflicts between CompSci classes and other classes. However, even though CalCentral will allow enrollment into both classes, it is still the student’s responsibility to plan their schedule carefully. Departments and faculty are NOT required or expected to accommodate students’ schedule conflicts, and the Instructor of Record may decline to enroll or Instructor Drop a student from a class if they cannot be present for all schedule activities, including midterms and finals.

    Best practice is to check attendance policies for each class and to speak to the instructors before enrolling in time conflicted classes.

  3. Waitlist Processing:
  • We will NOT purge the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

  • During the Adjustment Period, wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed. During Phases 1 and 2, students who meet reserve requirements for a class will be enrolled from the wait list if there are open seats, even before students with a better wait list position who do not meet reserve requirements.

  • If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

  • Waitlisted students who have time conflicts will no longer be held on the waitlist and will now be processed in sequential order like any other student. (As in the past, not meeting a reserve cap or exceeding the unit limit will still prevent students from being enrolled from the wait list.)

    Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

  1. 70% Rule - When hiring is uncertain for discussion section GSI/TA staff, we hold back 30% of seats. Once we know what the hiring will be for a class, we release these seats back to regular enrollment process. You can expect enrollment for these classes to expand.

  2. 999 sections will be used for many but not all upper div classes. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central. 

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change.   • Via course home page

Once the lecture day/time settles, some sections may shift as well so they don’t conflict with the new lecture time.

  • CS 194-034 – Enroll into the lecture only.

  • CS 195 – This class is temporarily CLOSED until we know what DeNero's CS 61A schedule is. When opened, enroll into the lecture only.

 

 

The remainder of this post contains general enrollment information.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS upper div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#upper

  2. Time Conflicts – Unless noted, the enrollment system WILL ALLOW time conflicts between CompSci classes and other classes. However, even though CalCentral will allow enrollment into both classes, it is still the student’s responsibility to plan their schedule carefully. Departments and faculty are NOT required or expected to accommodate students’ schedule conflicts, and the Instructor of Record may decline to enroll or Instructor Drop a student from a class if they cannot be present for all schedule activities, including midterms and finals.

    Best practice is to check attendance policies for each class and to speak to the instructors before enrolling in time conflicted classes.

  3. Waitlist Processing:
  • We will NOT purge the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

  • During the Adjustment Period, wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed. During Phases 1 and 2, students who meet reserve requirements for a class will be enrolled from the wait list if there are open seats, even before students with a better wait list position who do not meet reserve requirements.

  • If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

  • Waitlisted students who have time conflicts will no longer be held on the waitlist and will now be processed in sequential order like any other student. (As in the past, not meeting a reserve cap or exceeding the unit limit will still prevent students from being enrolled from the wait list.)

    Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

  1. 70% Rule - When hiring is uncertain for discussion section GSI/TA staff, we hold back 30% of seats. Once we know what the hiring will be for a class, we release these seats back to regular enrollment process. You can expect enrollment for these classes to expand.

  2. 999 sections will be used for many but not all upper div classes. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central. 

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu


Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

  • During first lecture
  • Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form or SignMeUp!)
  • Via course home page
